Title:
Protubera beiingensis sp. nov. (Protophallaceae, Phallales)
from China
Keywords:
Kobayasia, phalloid fungi, Protophallus, Protuberella,
sequestrate fungi
Abstract:
The genus Protubera contains gasteroid species. It is
globally distributed in tropical, subtropical and temperate areas, and
presently six species were accepted. In this paper, Protubera
beijingensis from northern China was described as a new species. Its
morphological description and illustration were provided in details and
compared with morphological similar species. A multi-gene phylogenetic
analysis based on nLSU, atp6 and rpb2 sequences of the genus Protubera
also supported the establishment of this new species.
